definition: to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough

sentences.english: For recent injuries such as sprains and headaches, cold compresses are recommended.
sentences.chinese: 對最近的一些傷病，例如扭傷和頭痛，建議進行冷敷。

sentences.english: Put some ice on your knee before it swells up.
sentences.chinese: 在你的膝蓋腫起來之前用冰塊冷敷一下。

sentences.english: Icing and anti-inflammatories will help with the pain and swelling.
sentences.chinese: 冷敷或者抗炎可以緩解疼痛和炎症。

sentences.english: What can be cold, conditions will be reduced.
sentences.chinese: 可以用冷敷一下，狀況會有所減輕。

sentences.english: Objective To discuss the more effective method to relieve the swelling pain of wound.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討更有效的減輕創傷腫痛的冷敷方法。

sentences.english: One old lady said it was soothing, like a cold compress.
sentences.chinese: 一位老太太說，這是舒緩的像一個冷敷。

sentences.english: Their succor amounted to a blood-letting and a few cold compresses.
sentences.chinese: 他們的救助方法就是放血或用冷敷布降溫。

sentences.english: Sore throats may be relieved by cold compresses.
sentences.chinese: 喉嚨痛用冷敷布敷一下可能會好一些。

sentences.english: Once the burn has cooled via cold water or compress exposure, apply lotion to the area.
sentences.chinese: 通過冷水或冷敷降溫後，在傷口處塗上潤膚露。

sentences.english: Both can be treated with cold raps wraps and medication.
sentences.chinese: 可以用冷敷或者藥物治療。

sentences.english: They caution that ice should be applied only 20 minutes at a time.
sentences.chinese: 他們還提醒說冷敷每次需要20分鐘。

sentences.english: Apply cold compresses on it to alleviate the pain.
Hot packs and cold compresses ease symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 熱敷與冷敷都可以緩解症狀。

definition: to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough
to reduce swelling/detumescence/(fig.) to streamline (a bloated bureaucracy etc)
